alert.note: Alert for Bath (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 03 at 3:23PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kentucky, including the following counties, Bath, Estill, Fleming, Menifee, Montgomery, Powell and Rowan. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 320 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain overspreading the area from the southwest. Up to an inch of rain will be possible in the most persistent showers between 3:30 and 6:30 pm. This will cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads, and roadside culverts, particularly in low lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Sterling, Stanton, Irvine, Flemingsburg, Owingsville, Frenchburg, Marshall, Jeffersonville, Camargo, Clay City, Ravenna, Sharpsburg, Salt Lick, Fairview, Peeled Oak, Kendall Springs, Stepstone, Crooks, Preston and Howards Mill.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
